borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development, by reason of its siting, scale, design and proximity to neighbours, would result in an undue loss of daylight/sunlight, outlook, and privacy, and an undue sense of overbearingness&nbsp;to neighbours properties at no.'s 91, 95, 97 and&nbsp;99&nbsp;Goresbrook Road. The proposal represents an unneighbourly form of development, and is contrary to:</p><ul><li>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)<br></li><li>Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li>Paragraph 4.2&nbsp;of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposed development, by reason of its protruding first floor extension and overall appearance including roof design,&nbsp;represents a poor addition which fails to respect the character and appearance of the host property, adjoining terrace and surrounding area. The scale of the first floor addition is considered to unbalance the position of the dwelling within the terrace row. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><div><ul><li><span pt="" sans="">Paragraphs 126, 130, and 134 of the&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)<br></li><li>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)<br></li><li>Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<br></li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<br></li><li>The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<br></li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul></div>
description: Construction of a front porch and the construction of an additional storey above existing bungalow
